title: Meta, Amazon, Snap, Pinterest: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; The Facebook parent's shares plunged on its poor results and gloomy outlook; Other tech stocks were also falling
text:
* Snap, Pinterest and Amazon are all due to report after markets close, and are being pulled down premarket amid the broader tech gloom. Snap dropped 16%, Pinterest fell 9% and Amazon shed 3.6%. Apple slipped 1% and Tesla fell 3.2%.

* ConocoPhillips and Eli Lilly are due to report before the open.

* T-Mobile US was a rare bright spot, gaining 7.7% premarket after the carrier reported higher revenue and total net customer additions in the fourth quarter.

* Merck edged up 0.7%. The drug company beat estimates for the fourth quarter after chalking up more than $950 million in sales from its Covid-19 antiviral molnupiravir.

* Qualcomm posted strong quarterly earnings and gave an upbeat sales outlook, underscoring that demand for chips for everything from smartphones to cars remains elevated. But good news can't always overcome a bad moodâ€”its shares slipped 3.5% premarket.

* MetLife slipped 1.5% off hours. High levels of Covid-19 deaths hurt fourth-quarter results in its employer-sponsored life insurance business, though the outsize payouts were more than offset by unusually strong investment gains.

Chart of the Day

* January's market turmoil hit even the safest bond funds. Some of those that held up best strayed from their traditional investing grounds, or concentrated on the shortest maturities.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Meta, Amazon, Snap, Pinterest: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
